name: J. Chandler
title: Perfect Gift for Younger Grandkid
text: My granddaughter loves this doodle toy. She is three and knew immediately how to use the magnetic pen and erase the screen. Unlike other magnetic boards, this one provides multiple learning games in addition to drawing: shapes, colors, puzzles, and more. The 7 in 1 activity board design means toddlers will enjoy for several years. A mesh storage bag is included for the beads and string. Recommended for hours of fun.

name: Pandagurl
title: Very light colored magnetic writing
text: I got this magnetic drawing board for my son. The writing on it shows up quite a bit lighter than other boards, so its more difficult to see whats being drawn. Especially with the yellow section its much less readable. The magnets shapes work well along with the pen aside from the light readability on the magnetic board.The beads on a string don‚Äôt really match well with the picture since you can only stack the beads on top of each other and the beads on a sting picture shows a side profile, which confused my son. I would suggest looking for a different magnetic board that is much more readable.

name: Jenna
title: My 2 year olds favorite toy
text: My 2 year old had a magnetic drawing board he used so much the eraser ended up breaking. I replaced it with this one and it's even better than the Melissa and Doug one he had originally and he carries it everywhere. The fun colors when he draws on it and the durability makes it the perfect gift for any drawing obsessed toddler you have in your life without the worry of the mess that comes with markers and crayons. A great on the go toy when we go on road trips or run errands.

text: My niece and nephews have been playing with this for a little bit now and are really liking all of the different activities that they can do with it.
